page.title: 01 WHITLEY BAY (1)
page.content: The area covered by this 12 km.sq.grid is extremeley diverse.The LAND slopes generally in a South Easterly direction and is undulating in nature,the highest point being 125m above sea-level.The GEOLOGY of the area mainly belongs to the CARBONIFEROUS PERIOD with LIMESTONE COAL MEASURES and SANDSTONE which is covered by BOULDER CLAY deposited by the last ICE AGE. There are four major LAND-USES in the area.(1)MIXED FARMING.There are four farms producing cereals,fattening livestock and producing milk.(2)COASTAL This consists of 2km of sandy beach backed by prommenade,boulder clay cliffs and grassland called the links. Further north the cliffs are higher and consist of sandstone which is being eroded rapidly.(3)RECREATION.Here golf, watersports,nature trails and services for tourists are important.
